ygData.subject: Re: [eqbards] Some Guk questions
ygData.msgSnippet: What I meant was - have the potions along and then you have a choice of which to use: invis song or invis to undead potions. You are correct: you can not be
ygData.messageBody:
What I meant was - have the potions along and then you have a choice of
which to use: invis song or invis to undead potions.

You are correct: you can not be invis and invis to undead at the same time.

I am not sure if *all* bard songs cancel invis. Mana song may not drop
others invis but other songs sure do. There is an interaction between songs
and invis - I used to think any song pulsing would kill invis - but now I am
not sure exactly how they interact, so usually I stop all songs before they
invis up.




----- Original Message -----
From: "Perhaps a Princess..." <sarah@...>
To: <eqbards@egroups.com>
Sent: Monday, May 22, 2000 11:14 AM
Subject: RE: [eqbards] Some Guk questions


> >You can get invis to undead potions to supplement your invis or go with
> >someone who can cast it. Or go with someone who can revive you
>
> Um. 1) If you are singing a song, doesn't casting any sort of
> invisibility on you get canceled by the next pulse of the song?
> (The Invisibility is canceled, the icon stays up. Windsong's been
> killed by someone with invisibility walking through her song radius,
> then out again, blissfully thinking he was invis, and he wasn't. The
> resulting
> train killed both him and her)
>
> (And no, you can't have both Invisibility and Invisibility to Undead
> cast on you by someone else. The spells overwrite each other. Only one
> is allowed)
